subject: Profanity
Philanthropy
Memorabilia
lead_paragraph: Tuesday is the 25th anniversary of the expletive-filled tirade against Chicago Cubs fans that nearly led Lee Elia’s firing as the team’s manager. Elia has a new rant for Chicago. Working with a memorabilia company, he is selling an autographed baseball in a case with an audio chip that plays a salute to Cubs fans far different from his words in 1983. He said he hoped to raise money for the Chicago Baseball Cancer Charities.
